page.title: 02Housing in Hunton
page.content: Hunton is an attractive village with a mixture of very old and new housing styles. Old Hall and Manor House are 17th century Listed Buildings and many of the cottages are built in the same traditional style of coursed rubble or cut stone. Few though still have their original slate roofs or sash windows. Lots of the older houses have changed hands in recent years and several have been completely renovated. Seven are now holiday homes. 16 Council houses and 5 pensioners' bungalows were built between 1950/60.Some fairly new modern houses and suburban style bungalows extend westwards and others are spread about the village.A small estate of 12 timber framed houses, started in 1981, is still unfinished. Sales are slow. ALL property prices are high and WELL beyond the reach of locals, yet there are no plans to provide more houses.
